entry.title: Newsletter #126
entry.content:
TechThursday is here!

We are featuring a T-shirt clash after more than a year, this time it is Shidhin and Geshan but different colors:) {% img center /images/posts/shidhin-geshan.jpg %}

We would also like to welcome back Shidhin from his vacation. And here is your weekly quota of some interesting links

Enjoy!

  • how to fix the go package management problem

  • logging v. instrumentation

  • new in symfony 2.8: clock mocking and time sensitive tests (symfony blog)

  • no cart left behind

  • playtime is over: investors want their money back

  • the $300 million button ux articles by uie

  • understanding git for real by exploring the .git directory — medium

entry.title: Newsletter #111
entry.content:
Hey!

Did you know it’s the “hug an engineer” week?

{% img center /images/hug_an_engineer.jpg %}

And with a big hug to all the engineers, we leave you with some likes for the weekend!

entry.title: Newsletter #37
entry.content:
It’s TechThursday again: here’s what we’ve been excited about over the past week!

  • Key-Value Observing with Facebook’s KVOController

  • Refactoring Legacy Code: Part 3 – Complex Conditionals

  • Introducing Synth – A new Node.js web framework designed just for AngularJs

  • Simple flavour of node binary management, no subshells, no profile setup, no convoluted api, just simple

  • The Absolute Beginner’s Guide to Node.js

  • 20 fantastically helpful IFTTT recipes – use IFTTT

  • AngularJS Routing Using UI-Router with states

  • Reports on slow-running tests in your PHPUnit test suite

  • Design principles

  • Gremlins.js, Monkey testing library for web apps and Node.js

  • Git tips and tricks
